intro: Tritonixia bolusii, commonly known as the Bolus's tritonixia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Tritonixia bolusii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
